clinical_study.brief_title: Ritual Training Program in HNC Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of a Ritual Training Program in the Head and Neck Cancer Patients: A Randomized Controlled Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Ministry of Science and Technology, Taiwan

clinical_study.source: Ministry of Science and Technology, Taiwan

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the effects of a ritual training program in head and neck cancer (HNC) patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of this study will to evaluate the effects of a ritual training program on disfigurement, self-esteem, social interaction, and body image in head and neck cancer (HNC) patients.
A prospective, repeated measures, randomized controlled therapeutic intervention design was employed. The experimental group will receive a ritual training program, and the control group will receive routine care. Patients will be assessed at three time points: baseline assessment (T0), and then at 1, 2, and 3-months (T1, T2, and T3) after participating in the ritual training program or routine care.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Disfigurement at 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Observer-rated disfigurement scale (1-9, higher score indicating greater levels of self-esteem higher disfigurement)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Body Image at 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Body Image Scale (0-30, higher scores indicate greater symptoms or distress in terms of body image concerns)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Social Interaction at 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Liebowitz Social Anxiety Scale(0-72, higher scores indicate greater fear or avoidance social interaction

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Depression at 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale-Depression Subscale (0-21, higher score indicates a higher level of depression).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Self-Esteem at 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Rosenberg Self-Esteem Scale(10-40, higher scores indicating greater levels of self-esteem)

arm_group.description: ritual training program for 8 weeks, biweekly

intervention.description: Ritual training program including education and demonstration

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- > 20 years old,
- newly diagnosed first occurrence of HNC,
- completion of treatment and more than 3 months post-treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
- recurrence
